alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 2:37PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Logan County, Phillips County, Sedgwick County and Washington County. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are expected to develop across the high country during the early afternoon and continue into the late evening hours. Storms will be capable of producing heavy rain with rainfall rates in excess of an 1.5 inches per hour, with flash flooding possible, especially over burn areas.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County
